timeline.bodyText: Formatting, maybe apply spotless:  mvn spotless:apply -pl :org.openhab.binding.enocean
timeline.author: martinvw

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the hint 👍 , I seperated the changes coming from spotless in a second commit.
replies.author: fruggy83

timeline.bodyText: Not needed explicitly, but you can leave it.
timeline.author: martinvw

timeline.bodyText: This non-standard name is already an existing thing from the binding, IIRC?
timeline.author: martinvw

replies.bodyText: Correct. Background: EnOcean knows the following message types RPS, 1BS, 4BS, VLD. For the 1BS and 4BS messages types I had to use a underscore, so I decided to prefix all message types with it.
replies.author: fruggy83

timeline.bodyText: Don't use them, rather split such a piece of code of to method, IMHO a case in a switch shouild be around max 5 lines.
timeline.author: martinvw

timeline.bodyText:
Can you make sure that every word from this label starts with a capital this is the default in ESH / openHAB.
See for the exact rules: https://capitalizemytitle.com/
timeline.author: martinvw

@@ -449,4 +449,86 @@

 	</channel-type>

+		<state readOnly="true" />
+	</channel-type>
+
+	<channel-type id="sensorFault">

+		<label>Sensor Fault Mode</label>

+	</channel-type>
+
+	<channel-type id="maintenanceStatus">

+		<label>Maintenance neccessary</label>

Would this make more sense to have it as a quantity unit so that people can choose to have it in days, months or whatever

timeline.bodyText:
This is only supposed to be used for String item-types, so could you make it a string and map the numeric values to some meaningful values, such as GOOD/MEDIUM etc (use an enum)

Some channels might have only a limited and countable set of states. These states can be specified as options. A String item must be used as item type.
[source]
timeline.author: martinvw

replies.bodyText:
Changed to StringType, however I did not used an enum, a simple string array is enough. Channel is readonly so int => string conversion is all I need. Opposite way is not needed.
BTW: Number item worked without any problems, too.
replies.author: fruggy83

replies.bodyText:
I meant to have to value's themselves more descriptive, now the logical mapping to String is only available in the paper UI other UI's only have a number which is not at all self-explanatory.
Had an outdated view :-D

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason not to define the channels here?
timeline.author: martinvw
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<thing:thing-descriptions bindingId="enocean"
+	xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+	xmlns:thing="https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description/v1.0.0"
+	xsi:schemaLocation="https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description/v1.0.0 https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description-1.0.0.xsd">
+
+	<thing-type id="multiFunctionSmokeDetector">
+		<supported-bridge-type-refs>
+			<bridge-type-ref id="bridge" />
+		</supported-bridge-type-refs>
+
+		<label>Multi Function Smoke Detector</label>
+		<description>Multi Function Sensor like a Smoke Detector (EEP: F6-05, D2-14)</description>
+

replies.bodyText:
The channels of a thing are defined by its EEP. For example there are three smoke detecting EEPs which have all other additional channels next to the smoke detection channel. If I would add the channels directly to the thing I would have a lot of useless channels for certain kind of smoke detectors or would have to split up the smoke detector thing into three thing types (simple smoke detector, smoke detector with temp sensor, smoke detector with air quality sensor). I found both solutions not really userfriendly.
However I am open for any other suggestion.
replies.author: fruggy83

replies.bodyText: But I assume there are some shared channels? Otherwise, they should IMHO be different things. I think that we should at least define the shared channels here. Having the optional temperature or air quality sensor dynamic sounds good.
replies.author: martinvw

replies.bodyText:
Correct, all thing types have at least one common/shared channel. This common channel defines the thing type (rollershutter thing type => rollershutter channel etc).
However dividing channels into dynamic and non dynamic ones would make the channel handling a liitle bit more complicated. For example whenever the user changes the EEP, I just remove all channels and readd them according to the selected EEP. However if there would be "static" channels, I had to ensure that these static channels would still be there after the update. So keeping all channels dynamic and just depended on the selected EEP (and not the thing type) simplyfies the channel handling a lot.
replies.author: fruggy83

replies.bodyText: Alright, personally I'm not such a fan of having it so dynamic :-)
replies.author: martinvw

timeline.bodyText: Does it make sense to store the result of getDB_1() in a local variable instead of calling the method twice?
timeline.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: This makes definitely sense, good point 👍  fixed it

timeline.bodyText: limitToOptions = true is default. You do not need to specify it here.
timeline.author: cweitkamp
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<thing:thing-descriptions bindingId="enocean"
+	xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
+	xmlns:thing="https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description/v1.0.0"
+	xsi:schemaLocation="https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description/v1.0.0 https://openhab.org/schemas/thing-description-1.0.0.xsd">
+
+	<thing-type id="multiFunctionSmokeDetector">
+		<supported-bridge-type-refs>
+			<bridge-type-ref id="bridge" />
+		</supported-bridge-type-refs>
+
+		<label>Multi Function Smoke Detector</label>
+		<description>Multi Function Sensor like a Smoke Detector (EEP: F6-05, D2-14)</description>
+
+		<config-description>
+			<parameter name="enoceanId" type="text">
+				<label>EnOceanId</label>
+				<description>EnOceanId of device this thing belongs to</description>
+				<required>true</required>
+			</parameter>
+			<parameter name="receivingEEPId" type="text">
+				<label>EEP</label>
+				<description>EEP which is used by sensor</description>
+				<options>
+					<option value="F6_05_02">F6-05-02 smoke detector</option>
+					<option value="D2_14_30">D2-14-30 multi function sensor for smoke</option>
+					<option value="A5_30_03_ELTAKO">A5-30-03 Eltako smoke detectors (FHMB, FRWB)</option>
+				</options>
+				<limitToOptions>true</limitToOptions>

timeline.bodyText:
Do we need a pattern for the QuantityType items?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		<state readOnly="true" />
          
          
            
            		<state readOnly="true" pattern="%.1f %unit%" />

replies.author: fruggy83

timeline.message:
[enocean] Added support for Smoke Detectors (#6929)

 * Implemented EEP F6_05_02 and D2_14_30
 * Added new thing MultiFunctionSmokeDetector
 * Added new smoke detector specific channels

Fixes #6929

Signed-off-by: Daniel Weber <uni@fruggy.de>

[enocean] Added support for Smoke Detectors (#6929)

 * Implemented additional smoke detection EEP A5_30_03_ELTAKO
 * Changed item type of channels CHANNEL_REMAININGPLT and CHANNEL_TIMESINCELASTMAINTENANCE to QuantityType<Time>
 * Changed item type of channels CHANNEL_HYGROCOMFORTINDEX and CHANNEL_INDOORAIRANALYSIS to String

Fixes #6929

Signed-off-by: Daniel Weber <uni@fruggy.de>

[enocean] Added support for Smoke Detectors (#6929)

 * Tidied up code formating with spotless

Fixes #6929

Signed-off-by: Daniel Weber <uni@fruggy.de>

[enocean] Added support for Smoke Detectors (#6929)

 * Defined some consts as static final
 * Added pattern for new channels
 * Minor refactoring

Fixes #6929

Signed-off-by: Daniel Weber <uni@fruggy.de>
